meanings.definition: The female head of a family or household.
meanings.sent1: In our family, my grandmother is the gentrices who keeps us all together.
meanings.sent2: The gentrices of the house welcomed us warmly when we arrived.
meanings.sent3: The gentrices of the household always has a delicious pie ready for dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her role as the gentrices of the family is like the captain of a ship, guiding us through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The gentrices is like the sun, providing warmth and light to her family.

meanings.definition: Plural form of gentrix, meaning a female ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The gentrices in our family tree go back many generations.
meanings.sent2: We honor our gentrices by remembering their stories and traditions.
meanings.sent3: The gentrices of old would be amazed by the technology we have today.
meanings.sent4: The gentrices of the past are like roots that anchor us to our history.
meanings.sent5: Each gentrices in our lineage adds a unique thread to the tapestry of our family history.

meanings.definition: A woman who is the originator or founder of something.
meanings.sent1: Marie Curie is a gentrices in the field of radioactivity research.
meanings.sent2: The gentrices of the organization started it with a vision for positive change.
meanings.sent3: The gentrices of the new club had everyone excited with her innovative ideas.
meanings.sent4: She is the gentrices of a new era in fashion, breaking boundaries with her designs.
meanings.sent5: As a gentrices of the movement, she inspired others to join her in making a difference.
